name: U.S. Agency for International Development
description: The United States Agency for International Development (USAID) is the United States federal government agency primarily responsible for administering civilian foreign aid. Responding to President Obama's pledge in his January 2013 State of the Union address to join with our allies to eradicate extreme poverty in the next two decades, USAID has adopted as its mission statement to partner to end extreme poverty and to promote resilient, democratic societies while advancing the security and prosperity of the United States.[3] USAID operates in Africa, Asia, Latin America and Europe.
